title: [Question] - Safe way to determine libSkiaSharp has loaded?
body:
Is there a safe way to determine if libSkiaSharp has loaded successfully and is available for use? A great way would be a method to get the native version number, and have this method throw an exception if the native library is not available.

Right now I am attempting to detect with this:

`            using (var bitmap = new SKBitmap())
            {
                return typeof(SKBitmap).GetTypeInfo().Assembly.GetName().Version.ToString();
            }
`

Unfortunately this causes an unhandled exception that I'm unable to trap and prevent:

> System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: obj
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Object:__icall_wrapper_mono_monitor_enter_v4 (object,intptr)
  at SkiaSharp.SKObject.Dispose (System.Boolean disposing) [0x00009] in <aa538976f268441bbb03d0446551ca24>:0 
  at SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.Dispose (System.Boolean disposing) [0x0002b] in <aa538976f268441bbb03d0446551ca24>:0 
  at SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.Finalize () [0x00000] in <aa538976f268441bbb03d0446551ca24>:0 
System.ArgumentNullException
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Object:__icall_wrapper_mono_monitor_enter_v4 (object,intptr)
  at SkiaSharp.SKObject.Dispose (System.Boolean disposing) [0x00009] in <aa538976f268441bbb03d0446551ca24>:0 
  at SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.Dispose (System.Boolean disposing) [0x0002b] in <aa538976f268441bbb03d0446551ca24>:0 
  at SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.Finalize () [0x00000] in <aa538976f268441bbb03d0446551ca24>:0
